       context: .
       dockerfile: integration/hdfs/Dockerfile
 
+  pandas-master:
+    # Usage:
+    #   export PYTHON_VERSION=3.6

   Can you add the necessary command line options to do a no-cache-rebuild of the pandas-master image to get the real latest pandas commit, not the one that was cached by docker?

kszucs closed pull request #2758: ARROW-1994: [Python] Test against Pandas master
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/2758
 
 
   

This is a PR merged from a forked repository.
As GitHub hides the original diff on merge, it is displayed below for
the sake of provenance:

As this is a foreign pull request (from a fork), the diff is supplied
below (as it won't show otherwise due to GitHub magic):

diff --git a/docker-compose.yml b/docker-compose.yml
index 9ee2b445d7..c1f798d20c 100644
--- a/docker-compose.yml
+++ b/docker-compose.yml
@@ -78,7 +78,7 @@ services:
 
   python:
     # Usage:
-    #   export PYTHON_VERSION=3.6
+    #   export PYTHON_VERSION=2.7|3.6|3.7
     #   docker-compose build cpp
     #   docker-compose build python
     #   docker-compose run python
@@ -181,6 +181,21 @@ services:
       context: .
       dockerfile: integration/hdfs/Dockerfile
 
+  pandas-master:
+    # Usage:
+    #   export PYTHON_VERSION=3.6
+    #   docker-compose build cpp
+    #   docker-compose build python
+    #   docker-compose build --no-cache pandas-master
+    #   docker-compose run pandas-master
+    image: arrow:pandas-master
+    build:
+      context: .
+      dockerfile: integration/pandas/Dockerfile
+    shm_size: 2G
+    volumes: *volumes
+
+
   # TODO(kszucs): dask-integration
   # TODO(kszucs): hive-integration
   # TODO(kszucs): spark-integration
diff --git a/integration/pandas/Dockerfile b/integration/pandas/Dockerfile
new file mode 100644
index 0000000000..8b56edf85d
--- /dev/null
+++ b/integration/pandas/Dockerfile
@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+FROM arrow:python-3.6
+
+# test against pandas' master
+RUN pip install git+https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas.git
diff --git a/python/Dockerfile b/python/Dockerfile
index 41d0441884..e97f82ec53 100644
--- a/python/Dockerfile
+++ b/python/Dockerfile
@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@ FROM arrow:cpp
 ARG PYTHON_VERSION=3.6
 ADD ci/conda_env_python.yml /arrow/ci/
 RUN conda install -c conda-forge \
-        --file arrow/ci/conda_env_python.yml && \
+        --file arrow/ci/conda_env_python.yml \
         python=$PYTHON_VERSION && \
     conda clean --all

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: We have seen recently a lot of breakage with Pandas master. This is an annoyance to our users and should already break in our builds instead of their chains. There is no need to add another entry to matrix, just in one of them to re-run the tests with the Pandas master after they ran successfully.

comments.body: This would be nice to have. Are there nightly pandas conda builds we could use? Otherwise this will increase our build times too much

For {{numpy}} and {{pandas}} there are pre-release wheels available, dask is using them: 

https://github.com/dask/dask/blob/3ad05d6eb70c84a2faea95ce15b5290b7b2eb4ae/continuous_integration/travis/install.sh#L101

We have a daily conda build test here: [https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas-ci.] I suppose we could upload the artefact to the pandas channel to have nightly conda builds (at least for linux) if that would be useful in addition to the wheels.
Linux-only nightly conda build would suffice for our purposes
Moved to 0.11. I think this will depend on our ability to run nightlies
